Hello, you have reached the White House Hotline.

Please enter your nationality as a country code followed by the pound key. If you do not know your country code, please press the asterisk key.
Country codes are international standards established by the International Telecommunication Union to identify each subscriber's country.

Confirmed as {nation}. Thank you.
Confirmed as
Thank you.

If you are staff for unofficial diplomacy, press 1. For official diplomacy staff, press 2. For regional government staff involved in public diplomacy without national diplomatic authority, press 3. For senior officials of central government agencies with diplomatic authority, press 4. For minister or vice-minister level officials, press 5. For anyone above that level, press 6.
You are from {nation} and fall under the {rank_type} category, correct?
You are from
and fall under the
category, correct?
If you wish to speak directly with the President due to an urgent situation, press 1. If the matter is less urgent or you wish to speak with an operator, press 2. For other inquiries, press 3.
A hotline access code is required to continue. Please enter the six-digit hotline code followed by the pound key.
The code you entered is invalid or unauthorized. Please re-enter your hotline code. To try again, press 1. To return to the main menu, press 0.
Welcome. Please wait a moment while we connect you with a government official.
We apologize, but the representative is currently unavailable. To schedule a call, press 1. If there is an emergency that cannot wait, press 2.
Reserved. The current time is {now}, and your call has been scheduled for {res_time}.
Reserved. The current time is
and your call has been scheduled for
We will do our best to help resolve the situation. Please specify the nature of the emergency. For economic crisis, press 1. For natural disaster, press 2. For military or security risks, press 3.

Please specify the nature of the military risk. For terror intelligence, press 1. For signs of military conflict, press 2. For local unrest, press 3. For a declaration of war, press 4. For a nuclear emergency, press 5.

A nuclear emergency is a critical matter. If you need assistance with missile interception due to an error or technical issue, press 1. For nuclear power plant anomalies or destruction forecasts, press 2.
You may request a special US Air Force interception mission through the Department of Defense. A special military action authorization code is required. If ready, press 1. For the main menu, press 0.
To proceed, enter the four-digit special military action authorization code followed by the pound key.
The code you entered is for {action_desc}. Do you wish to continue? Press 1 for Yes, 2 for No.
The code you entered is for
Do you wish to continue? Press 1 for Yes, 2 for No.
Are you sure you want to continue? Once a mission is executed, it cannot be undone. To continue, press 1. To cancel, press 2.
The military action request has been canceled. Please start again from the beginning.
The code you entered is incorrect. To try again, press 1. To return to the main menu, press 0.
Confirmed. The code has been transmitted to the US Department of Defense, and the special interception mission has been authorized. Thank you for your cooperation.
Connecting to an operator. Please wait. Your queue number is {wait_num}, and the estimated wait time is {wait_min} minutes.
Connecting to an operator. Please wait. Your queue number is
and the estimated wait time is
minutes.
We are experiencing unusually high call volume, resulting in longer wait times. To stay on the line, press 1. For the main menu, press 0.
For trade agreements, press 1. For denuclearization policy, press 2. For hotline authentication code inquiries, press 3.
To learn about nuclear weapons, press 1. For weapons available to the US, press 2.
We are always seeking ways to maintain peace. To learn about missiles from major nations, press 1. For more details, visit the USAID website.
Press 1 for Russia, 2 for China, 3 for India, 4 for South Korea, 5 for North Korea, or 6 for Japan.
North Korean missiles include the Hwasong-11, Hwasong-5, Hwasong-6, Hwasong-7, Pukguksong-2, Hwasal-2, Hwasong-10, and the Hwasong-20 ICBM.
For offensive weapons, press 1. For defensive weapons such as interceptors, press 2.
Defensive weapons include aircraft capable of intercepting ballistic missiles. For missile power codes, press 1. For interception method codes, press 2.
For low-speed ballistic missiles, press 1. For high-speed ballistic missiles, press 2.
The first two digits of the special military action authorization code for low-speed ballistic missiles are {code}.

For Northern Hemisphere missiles (X0 method), press 1. For Southern Hemisphere missiles (Y0 method), press 2.
